fr.ign.artiscales.goal

Class ZoneDivision

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.ign.artiscales.goal.ZoneDivision

  • public class ZoneDivision
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulation following this goal operates on a zone rather than on parcels. Zones are usually taken from a zoning plan and their integration is made with the createZoneToCut(String, SimpleFeatureCollection, SimpleFeatureCollection) method. The parcel which are across the zone are cut and the parts that aren't contained into the zone are kept with their attributes. The chosen parcel division process (OBB by default) is then applied on the zone.
    Author:
    Maxime Colomb

      • SAVEINTERMEDIATERESULT

        public static boolean SAVEINTERMEDIATERESULT
        If true, will save a shapefile containing only the simulated parcels in the temporary folder.

      • OVERWRITESHAPEFILES

        public static boolean OVERWRITESHAPEFILES
        If true, overwrite the output saved shapefiles. If false, happend the simulated parcels to a potential already existing shapefile.

      • zoneDivision

        public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection zoneDivision(org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection initialZone,
                                                                            org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection parcels,
                                                                            java.io.File tmpFolder,
                                                                            java.io.File zoningFile,
                                                                            double maximalArea,
                                                                            double minimalArea,
                                                                            double maximalWidth,
                                                                            double streetWidth,
                                                                            int decompositionLevelWithoutRoad)
                                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Merge and recut a specific zone. Cut first the surrounding parcels to keep them unsplited, then split the zone parcel and remerge them all into the original parcel file A bit complicated algorithm to deal with unexisting peaces of parcels (as road)
        Parameters:
        initialZone - : Zone wich will be used to cut parcels. Will cut parcels that intersects them and keep their infos. Will then fill the empty spaces in between the zones and feed it to the OBB algorithm.
        parcels - : Parcel plan
        tmpFolder -
        zoningFile -
        maximalArea -
        minimalArea -
        maximalWidth -
        streetWidth -
        decompositionLevelWithoutRoad -
        Returns:
        The input parcel SimpleFeatureCollection with the marked parcels replaced by the simulated parcels. All parcels have the ParcelSchema.getSFBMinParcel() schema.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • zoneDivision

        public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection zoneDivision(org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection initialZone,

      • createZoneToCut

        public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection createZoneToCut(java.lang.String zoneToCutName,
                                                                               org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection zoning,
                                                                               org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection parcels)
                                                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Create a zone to cut by selecting features from a shapefile regarding a fixed value. Name of the field is by default set to TYPEZONE and must be changed if needed with the GeneralFields.setZoneGenericNameField(String) method. Also takes a bounding SimpleFeatureCollection to bound the output
        Parameters:
        zoneToCutName - Name of the zone to be cut
        zoning - Collection of zones to extract the wanted zone from (ussualy a zoning plan)
        parcels - Collection of parcel to bound the process on a wanted location
        Returns:
        An extraction of the zoning collection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
